caption.p: Precipitation extremes may be underestimated, leading to misinformed adaptation, when internal climate variability is not considered. ( A) (i–iii) Analysis within Contiguous US showing RL 100 for three NCAR LENS CESM1 CAM5.2 runs. (iv) 27-model Inter Quartile Range (IQR) computed from MICE. (v-vii) same as (i-iii) but for three models from MME selected randomly. (viii) same as (iv) but for MME. ( B) IQR from MME shows significantly larger variability (p-value < 0.05) but significantly higher upper bounds are obtained from MME. ( C) Shows adaptation implications via DDF curves (e.g., in NE zone, RL 100 from MME compares to RL 30 from MICE). Three of nine US hydrometeorological zones are shown, the rest are in SI (Figs S2– S3). The results demonstrate the criticality of ICV to informing the design or operations of hydraulic infrastructures and water resources planning or management.
